isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Lower Crankcase

step1.para: Make sure the lower crankcase sealing recesses are free of any dirt and oil.
Install two new lower crankcase seals.

note.para: Make certain that the lower crankcase machined bearing surfaces are free of all dirt and oil.

step1.para: Install bearings into the lower crankcase, making sure bearing alignment tab is fitted into machined notch.
Apply clean engine oil to all lower bearing inserts, crankshaft journals and lower crankcase bolts.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure the longer main cap bolts (M14 x 127) are installed inboard and the shorter bolts (M14 x 114) are installed outboard.

step1.para: Install the lower crankcase over the crankshaft being careful not to bump crankshaft and knock any bearings out.

figure.caption: Lower crankcase main bearing bolt torque sequence

step1.para:
Install all 16 lower crankcase main bearing mounting bolts. Tighten main cap bolts to the special torque as follows using the sequence shown in the "Lower crankcase main bearing mounting bolt tightening sequence"
:

step2.para:
Initially torque bolts to 122 N·m (90 lbf·ft) in the numerical sequence shown in "Lower crankcase main bearing mounting bolt tightening sequence"
.

Increase torque for bolts to 163 N·m (120 lbf·ft) in the numerical sequence shown in "Lower crankcase main bearing mounting bolt tightening sequence"
.

Increase torque for bolts to a final value of 231 N·m (170 lbf·ft) in the numerical sequence shown in "Lower crankcase main bearing mounting bolt tightening sequence"
.

figure.caption: Lower crankcase outer bolt torque sequence

step1.para:
Install six bolts (M8 x 30) around outside of lower crankcase. Tighten bolts to the standard torque
using the sequence shown in "Lower crankcase outer bolt tightening sequence"
.
Check crankshaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Mount dial indicator on crankcase with indicator tip on the end of crankshaft flange as shown.
Pry crankshaft forward with pry bar and zero dial indicator.
Pry crankshaft back and forth while reading dial indicator. Record end play.

step1.para: Check and record camshaft gear-to-crankshaft gear backlash as follows:

note.para: Crankshaft gear must be fixed, not allowed to rotate, only the camshaft gear should be allowed to rotate, otherwise the reading will be invalid.

step2.para:
Mount Dial Indicator with Magnetic Base onto rear of engine. See Special Service Tools
.
Position dial indicator tip onto a gear tooth and remove any lash.
Zero dial indicator index.
Rotate gear by hand and read indicator. Record backlash.

If backlash exceeds specified limits, replace camshaft gear. See Specifications
.

step1.para: Check and record primary balancer gear-to-crankshaft gear backlash as follows:

note.para: Crankshaft gear must be fixed, not allowed to rotate, only the primary balancer gear should be allowed to rotate, otherwise the reading will be invalid.

step2.para:
Mount dial indicator with magnetic base
onto rear of engine.
Position dial indicator tip on primary balancer gear tooth and remove lash.
Zero dial indicator index.
Rotate gear by hand and read indicator. Record backlash.

If backlash exceeds specified limits, replace primary balancer gear. See Specifications
.

step1.para: Check and record the primary balancer shaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Reposition dial indicator tip to balance shaft, not gear.
Push camshaft to the front of the engine.
Zero dial indicator index.

Place a small pry bar between the primary balance gear and crankcase. Lightly pry primary balancer gear toward indicator. Compare dial indicator reading with specifications. See Specifications
.

step1.para: Slide a new dipstick tube seal onto oil level gauge assembly and install into lower crankcase, making certain that the seal is fully seated within the lower crankcase.
